column5: I wasn't suppose to be going out today but I couldn't resist    2h30 hours to limit out x2 with a good friend of mine Ray.... here he just caught his last one    The usual sink shot    my limit    TroutJunkie

Some details from today.... Raymond and I hadn't wet a line in some 20 years since our last time out barbotte fishing in the Gatineau Park   He was my wife's colleague at work and good friend...  now retired and will be celebrating his 70th next week!!!  After some thoughts of, am I going fishing or not tomorrow, gave him a call to see if he was interested in some trout fishing... without hesitation, the answer was YESSSS!!!!  5h00am, look out the kitchen window and see 6C on the thermometer     Not again    Winds was blowing directly from the North.... my my my what was I thinking     WELL  turns out it was a perfect day trouting and they were hungry  We both limited out in 2h30 hours of hard work Here's a little video I made for this occasion... Enjoy
Dang it Jaques, my mouth is watering. Those look delicious.
Awesome stuff. Sometimes, with fishermen, 20 years can seem like 20 minutes.
Aye, laisses-en pour moi Jacques!    Great speck shore fishin' right there. Since it was so cold I guess the black flies weren't that bad? Or maybe even non-existant.

They sure are Jeremy!!!   Thanks Rob!!!  This priceless moment was long overdue... had an awesome time out there   Pas de problème W`m F... j`vais t'en laisser    The flies were non existent early morning but as soon as it warmed up a few degrees, some were coming out of hibernation... the wind played a great role in keeping them in check
nice speckle-rim! YOur making up for this quiet winter. How big was the biggest?
Thanks Chad!!!  Yes I found the on / off switch   Biggest was 9" and some
nice fish there  good video too
Thanks Terry!!!  I tried something different in the vid's intro... I think it works with the choice of music I selected
yeah thought it was good, now I need to work a little harder on my videos

I created the intro with Photoscape, a free utility, off the net you can download    The 2 new sequences was almost 4 hours in the making  Mind you, I was learning how to use the program   Then, imported those two into MS Movie Maker to finalize it.
Well I guess that makes up for the winter  (and the broken auger ?) That was you rite?  Don.
Thanks Don!!! Yes it was me... I was baffled by the broken auger this hard water season    but now, with the results I'm having... it's all good for now
Had to fix the clock cause it was broken... some of the pieces made it into a very hot environment  Breakfast for champions    This for my friend Dave aka fish farmer
Mmmmm great stuff Jacques!!!
Thanks Frankie!!!  Cold water speckies... Doesn't taste much better than that
Very nice report Jaques.
Tres Bon Jacques!
Nice report Jacques!  That plate with cooked specks just had me cover the keyboard in drool....you owe me a new keyboard.....or a plate of specks.
Thanks Dan!!!   Merci Drew!!!   Thanks Will!!!  We could always trade... walleye for specks
